structures.tree
Class BinarySearchTree<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>

java.lang.Object
  structures.tree.BinarySearchTree<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of data stored in the nodes of the tree, must implement Comparable with the compareTo method.
public class BinarySearchTree<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements a simple (not balanced) generic binary search tree. Duplicate keys are not permitted.

Author:
Sesh Venugopal

Field Summary
(package private)  int size
          Number of entries in this BST.
(package private)  BinaryTree<T> tree
          Binary tree component which maintains the tree structure.

Method Detail

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Tells whether this BST is empty or not.

Returns:
True if this BST is empty, false otherwise.

recursiveSearch

protected BinaryTree<T> recursiveSearch(BinaryTree<T> root,
                                        T key)
Implements a recursive binary search on a binary (search) tree given its root, looking for a given key.

Parameters:
root - Root of binary (search) tree to be searched.
key - Key that is searched for.
Returns:
The binary (search) tree node whose data matches the key, null if no match is found for the key in the tree.

search

public T search(T key)
Searches this BST for a given key.

Parameters:
key - Key that is searched for.
Returns:
Data entry in this BST that matches the given key, null if no match is found for the key in this BST.

insert

public void insert(T item)
Inserts a given item into this BST.

Parameters:
item - Item to be inserted.
Throws:
OrderViolationException - If there is already a key in this BST that matches this item, i.e. inserting would result in duplicate keys.

deleteHere

protected void deleteHere(BinaryTree<T> deleteNode,
                          BinaryTree<T> attach)
Attaches a given tree node to the parent of another node which is deleted after this method. The attachment to the parent node will be on the side at which the to-be-deleted node is.

Parameters:
deleteNode - Node whose parent will receive new node as right or left child, depending on whether this node is its parent's right or left child.
attach - The node to be attached to parent of deleteNode.

findPredecessor

protected BinaryTree<T> findPredecessor(BinaryTree<T> node)
Returns the node that is the inorder predecessor of a given node, with the precondition that the given node has a non-null left child.

Parameters:
node - Node whose inorder predecessor is to be found.
Returns:
Inorder predecessor of given node.

delete

public T delete(T key)
Deletes from this BST the item that matches the given key,and returns the item.

Parameters:
key - Key of to-be-deleted item.
Returns:
The deleted item.
Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException - If there is no item in this BST that matches the given key.

minKey

public T minKey()
Finds the minimum-valued key item in this BST.

Returns:
Item in this BST that has the minimum of all key values.
Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException - If this BST is empty.

maxKey

public T maxKey()
Finds the maximum-valued key item in this BST.

Returns:
Item in this BST that has the maximum of all key values.
Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException - If this BST is empty.

size

public int size()
Returns the number of items in this BST.

Returns:
Number of items in this BST.

recursivePreOrder

protected void recursivePreOrder(BinaryTree<T> root,
                                 Visitor<T> visitor)
Implements a recursive preorder traversal on a binary (search) tree given its root, calling the given visitor's visit method when a node is visited.

Parameters:
root - Root of binary (search) tree on which preorder traversal is performed.
visitor - Visitor instance in which client-specific visit action is defined.
